Cara Tepat Bos Muda Hadapi Anak Buah 'Senior'
07 Nov 2019, 10:01 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Menjadi pemimpin di usia muda dan punya banyak 'anak buah' yang berusia lebih tua alias senior memang tak mudah. Berikut triknya. ( Bench Accounting via StockSnap)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Risa Santoso mendadak terkenal karena beberapa waktu lalu dilantik menjadi rektor. Di usia 27 tahun, dia menjadi rektor termuda di Indonesia. Penunjukkan Risa jadi rektor termuda ini semakin memperkuat posisi dan jadi lebih diperhitungkan dalam berbagai tingkatan birokrasi di zaman ini. Sebagai awalnya, penunjukkan Nadiem Makarim sebagai menteri muda di kabinet Jokowi. Saat ini, Risa juga yang masih muda ditunjuk untuk memegang posisi tinggi. Bicara soal kesiapan seseorang memang tak terbatas pada usia. Psikolog Rena Masri yang dihubungi CNNIndonesia.com beberapa waktu lalu mengungkapkan ada sisi positif di balik usia muda di jabatan tinggi. Mungkin ada perubahan positif. Orang muda kan lebih cepat, kreatif, jadi bisa saja bikin perubahan positif meski effort (usaha) bakal lebih banyak," kata dia saat dihubungi CNNIndonesia.com tentang penunjukkan menteri muda Jokowi. Dalam ranah psikologi, jenjang usia 25 tahun termasuk dalam jenjang dewasa awal. Di usia ini jadi masa orang mengembangkan karier dan menikah didukung perkembangan fisik dan emosi yang sudah matang. Biasanya, lanjut Rena, di usia ini orang lebih dinamis, enerjik dan lebih update soal perkembangan teknologi.Sedangkan kematangan kadang tidak berbanding lurus dengan usia. Ada mereka yang berusia 40 tahun tetapi belum matang atau dewasa begitu pula sebaliknya."Menurut saya, harus dilihat latar belakangnya dulu, apa cukup mampu mengemban tanggung jawab, bisa jadi dia baru lulus, lalu ketahanan terhadap stres minim sehingga kalau stres sedikit kemudian jadi tertekan, pekerjaan terganggu, ada juga yang sudah matang dan bisa [adaptasi]," jelasnya.Hanya saja tak dimungkiri akan ada banyak tantangan yang harus dihadapi. Salah satunya ada memiliki anak buah yang usianya jauh lebih matang dan dewasa di banding si bos. Mengatasi anak buah dengan rentang usia yang hampir sama atau jauh di bawah saja masih sering terjadi pertentangan. Apalagi dengan anak buah yang usianya jauh lebih senior. Rena memberikan catatan bahwa pemimpin usia muda perlu mengenal dan mengerti perkembangan psikologis mereka yang masuk usia senior."Meski jabatan di atas para senior ini, tetap harus menghargai dan menghormati, tetap bisa mendengarkan mereka, belajar dari pengalaman mereka," katanya.Mungkin yang dipimpin para senior dengan dengan segala tuntutan untuk tetap menaruh hormat pada mereka, tetapi jangan sampai kehilangan peran sebagai pemimpin. Kemampuan kepemimpinan jelas harus ditunjukkan bahwa pemimpin bisa membimbing, memotivasi staf dan membangun team work yang solid.Dia pun menambahkan agar tak disepelekan staf yang usianya lebih tua, sebaiknya pemimpin di usia muda tetap bisa tegas dan tetap memiliki integritas."Seperti pembagian jobdesk jelas, aturan jelas sehingga akhirnya enggak bossy. Kalau bossy kan ada jarak. Nah tetapkan aturan yang jelas sehingga karyawan yang lebih tua tetap bisa mengerjakan apa yang jadi tuntutan pekerjaan sekaligus tetap humble dengan mereka," pungkas Rena.(els/chs)

The Right Way Young Bosses Face 'Senior' Men
Nov 7 2019, 10:01 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Being a leader at a young age and having a lot of 'subordinates' who are older alias senior is indeed not easy. Here are the tricks. (Bench Accounting via StockSnap)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Risa Santoso was suddenly famous because some time ago he was appointed as Chancellor. At the age of 27, he became the youngest chancellor in Indonesia. The appointment of Risa to be the youngest chancellor strengthened his position and became more calculated in various levels of bureaucracy at this time. For starters, the appointment of Nadiem Makarim as junior minister in Jokowi's cabinet. Currently, Risa is also a young one who is appointed to hold a high position. Talking about one's readiness is indeed not limited to age. Psychologist Rena Masri who was contacted by CNNIndonesia.com some time ago revealed that there was a positive side to the young age in high positions. Maybe there is a positive change. Young people are faster, more creative, so they can make positive changes even though efforts (efforts) will be more, "he said when contacted by CNNIndonesia.com about the appointment of young minister Jokowi. In the realm of psychology, the age of 25 years is included in the early adult level. At this age, it is a time for people to develop their careers and get married, supported by physical and emotional development that is already mature.Normally, continued Rena, at this age people are more dynamic, energetic and more updated about technological developments. While maturity is sometimes not directly proportional to age. those who are 40 years old but not yet mature or mature and vice versa. "In my opinion, it must be seen from his background first, is it enough to be able to assume responsibility, it could be that he just graduated, then resistance to stress is minimal so that if stress is a little then it gets depressed, work is interrupted, some are already ripe and can [adaptation], "he explained. Only there is no doubt there will be many challenges. dreams that must be faced. One of them has a subordinate whose age is much more mature and mature than the boss. Overcoming subordinates with an age range that is almost the same or far below are still often in conflict. Especially with subordinates whose age is much more senior. Rena notes that young leaders need to know and understand the psychological development of those who are entering senior age. "Even though these positions are above those of seniors, they must respect and respect them, they can still listen to them, learn from their experiences," he said. the seniors with all the demands to remain respectful to them, but do not lose the role of leader. Leadership capabilities must clearly be demonstrated that leaders can guide, motivate staff and build solid team work. He also added that older staff should not be underestimated, young leaders should be able to remain assertive and still have integrity. "Like a clear jobdesk division, the rules are clear so that eventually they are not bossy. If there is a distance bossy. Now set clear rules so that older employees can still do what the demands of the job are at the same time keep humble with them, "concluded Rena. (els / chs)
